skill.name: research-lookup
skill.description: Look up current research information using Perplexity Sonar Pro Search or Sonar Reasoning Pro models through OpenRouter. Automatically selects the best model based on query complexity. Search academic papers, recent studies, technical documentation, and general research information with citations.
skill.summary: Look up current research information using Perplexity Sonar Pro Search or Sonar Reasoning Pro models...
skill.author: K-Dense-AI

security_audit.summary: This is a legitimate academic research tool that makes API calls to OpenRouter for literature searches. All 146 static findings are false positives: (1) API key environment reads are standard authentication for OPENROUTER_API_KEY, (2) network calls target the legitimate OpenRouter API endpoint, (3) 'external commands' flagged in SKILL.md are documentation examples showing command syntax, not runtime code execution, and (4) 'weak cryptographic algorithm' mentions are ML architecture names (transformer, RNN) misidentified as cryptographic algorithms. No malicious patterns detected after intent analysis.

content.user_title: Search Academic Literature and Research Papers
content.value_statement: Finding current academic research requires searching multiple databases and evaluating source quality. This tool searches scholarly literature through Perplexity Sonar models with automatic model selection based on query complexity and citation-focused results.
actual_capabilities: Search academic papers and scholarly literature using Perplexity Sonar models
Automatic model selection between fast lookup and deep reasoning modes
Extract and format citations with DOI links and source attribution
Prioritize high-impact journals and highly-cited papers in results
Batch multiple research queries with rate limiting
Filter by publication timeframe and venue quality
limitations: Requires OPENROUTER_API_KEY for access to Perplexity models
Cannot access paywalled full-text content directly
May miss very recent papers not yet indexed in databases
Dependent on OpenRouter service availability and rate limits

use_cases.title: Literature Review Assistant
use_cases.description: Gather current research for manuscripts and stay current with recent developments in your field.

use_cases.title: Academic Source Finder
use_cases.description: Find credible academic sources for essays and papers with proper citations.

use_cases.title: Technical Documentation Lookup
use_cases.description: Look up specifications, protocols, and methodologies for technical documentation.

prompt_templates.title: Basic Search
prompt_templates.prompt: Research the latest advances in [TOPIC] from 2024. List key papers with citations.

prompt_templates.title: Comparative Analysis
prompt_templates.prompt: Compare [METHOD_A] versus [METHOD_B] for [APPLICATION]. Include pros, cons, and relevant studies.

prompt_templates.title: Deep Analysis
prompt_templates.prompt: Explain the mechanism of [PHENOMENON] and identify key papers that established this understanding.

prompt_templates.title: Citation Finding
prompt_templates.prompt: Find the most influential foundational papers on [TOPIC] that every researcher should know.

output_examples.input: Recent advances in mRNA vaccine technology 2024
output: Key Findings: Summary of 5 major research advances from 2024
Top Paper: Smith et al. 2024, Nature Medicine (cited 200+ times)

output_examples.input: Compare transformer versus RNN for sequence modeling
output: Transformer models show superior parallelization and long-range dependency handling
RNNs offer lower computational overhead for short sequences
Key Study: Vaswani et al. 2017 (Attention Is All You Need) - 50,000+ citations
Performance benchmarks across multiple NLP tasks included

output_examples.input: Western blot protocol for protein detection
output: Step-by-step protocol from recent Nature Methods review
Common pitfalls and troubleshooting tips provided
Reference to seminal antibody validation paper

best_practices: Use specific query terms including timeframe and research type for best results
Use reasoning keywords like compare, analyze, or explain for complex queries
Verify all citations against primary sources before including in manuscripts
Break complex research questions into multiple focused queries
anti_patterns: Do not use vague queries like tell me about AI - be specific about topic and scope
Do not rely solely on AI-generated summaries - always verify with primary sources
Do not use for circumventing paywalls or accessing restricted content
Do not present AI-generated content as original research without proper attribution

faq.question: What models does this skill use?
faq.answer: It uses Perplexity Sonar Pro Search for fast lookups and Sonar Reasoning Pro for complex analytical queries.

faq.question: How does automatic model selection work?
faq.answer: Queries with reasoning keywords like compare, analyze, or explain trigger the deep reasoning model automatically.

faq.question: What API key do I need?
faq.answer: Set the OPENROUTER_API_KEY environment variable with your OpenRouter API credentials.

faq.question: What sources does it prioritize?
faq.answer: Peer-reviewed journals, high-impact venues like Nature and Science, and highly-cited papers are prioritized.

faq.question: Can I save research results to a file?
faq.answer: Use the --output flag to save results to a file, or --json for JSON format output.

faq.question: How many citations does it return?
faq.answer: The skill returns 5-10 high-quality citations with full bibliographic information and DOI links when available.
